file_content.text: Welcome, my lord. Maris Csayni, Imperial Intelligence. Your arrival is most fortuitous.
Welcome, sir. Agent Csayni. Impeccable timing. Having a cipher in the field is more than I could have hoped for.
I trust you've found Taris as pleasant as any fetid, rakghoul-infested planet can be.
Despite our best efforts, the Republic continues to expand their presence--infecting every corner of this disgusting planet.
This planet's stubborn refusal to die would be admirable if it weren't so... inconvenient.
I've been monitoring the Republic's reconstruction efforts. Their most ambitious project is a joint effort with the Cathar--a massive Tarisian skyscraper.
"New Tarisian Dawn," they're calling it; maudlin, I know, but it's already inspired the Republic and Cathar to intensify their efforts.
Morale is the key to winning Taris--or destroying it. The last thing we need is a symbol for would-be colonists to rally behind.
Our agents have identified several infrastructural weak points where explosive charges could help reduce that building to smoldering rubble.
Unfortunately, the Republic and Cathar have been training an elite guard to oversee the building's coronation. A more... militant symbol of their alliance.
I need someone to break in and plant those charges. Can you handle this?
Perhaps now the Republic sees the futility in trying to revive this planet.
You return. Judging by those explosions, I'd say your mission was a success.
Our recon droids obtained footage of a number of dead snipers. I look forward to studying the holovids later.
I can hardly wait to raze that blasted edifice to the ground. For the Empire, of course.
I did my part. If you want off this planet, make sure you do yours.
It's in your hands now.
That building's days are numbered, I assure you.
Happy to do it.
I'm done.
We'll let the Republic play with their pet project awhile longer. Let their spirits get even higher before we crush them.
Have fun out there.
Welcome, hunter. Maris Csayni, Imperial Intelligence. I'd like to employ your services.
Welcome. Maris Csayni, Imperial Intelligence. Your arrival is well-timed.
It's nothing more than defiance for its own sake.
It's mere insolence.
It's absurd. Only the dead should live in a graveyard.
That won't do.
Indeed. The more they establish themselves here, the longer it will take to drive them out.
I get the feeling you don't like it here.
Not fond of Taris?
The Republic has to latch onto whatever comfort it can find.
They're just desperate.
Too true. They cling to that tower like an infant clutching its blanket.
Destroy the building. Problem solved.
Blow it up.
My thoughts, exactly.
Your point?
I will bury the Republic in their own ambition.
Gladly.
The Republic's greatest triumph shall become their greatest failure.
A fitting end.
I knew you'd appreciate the irony.
I'm used to taking down people, not buildings, but I'll do it.
I'm on it.
Crush their forces and their spirits. Textbook sabotage.
I've done this before.
If I can leave.
Eager to get off this planet, too? I sympathize.
Those charges alone won't level the structure, but they'll cripple it so we can easily demolish it when the time is right.
One last thing--a team of Republic snipers is camped out on the top floor of the skyscraper.
They've been tracking our movements and directing their ground forces against us. If possible, I'd like to see these upstarts... disposed of.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
I'm never going to get off this planet, am I?
This dying world has limped on long enough.
